intro: Parosela mollis var. mollissima, commonly known as the soft mossy plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is often found growing on rocky substrates or in dense undergrowth. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a sought-after species for botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
